## Introduction

We developed an individual-based susceptible-exposed-infectious-recovered (SEIR) model to simulate the effect(s) of interventions that modify air quality on the transmission of an airborne pathogen. The model simulates a human population structured by both age group and their social mixing patterns across multiple locations within household, school, workplace, leisure venue and community settings.
